David Luiz didn't refuse to train. I was told he fell out with Lampard after a poor outing against Salzburg and refused to take corrections.

It was Lampard's decision to keep him away from training with the group while his transfer is sorted out.

No need to call him names.
https://mobile.twitter.com/Blue_Footy/status/1159205006530293760
David Luiz was unhappy about being left out of Saturday’s XI vs Gladbach.

Matt Law

Luiz disruption and his push to join Arsenal comes just a week after praising the new DNA at Chelsea and claiming everyone was working together as a family. A week is a long time in football it seems...#cfc

Frank Lampard decided Luiz should train away from the rest of his Chelsea players at Cobham, following a week in which the Brazilian is believed to have become a disruptive influence | @Matt_Law_DT

(link: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/08/07/david-luiz-refuses-train-chelsea-attempt-force-move-arsenal/) telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/…

Chelsea are thought to be open to letting Luiz go with Lampard unlikely to consider him for selection. Given the fact that he could have left for nothing, a fee between £5million and £10m will be considered good business.

The situation regarding Luiz goes some way to explaining why 21-year-old defender Fikayo Tomori has not yet left Chelsea on loan.

Chelsea had been planning to send Tomori out for the season and Everton had been touted as the most likely destination. But with Luiz now trying to force a move and the Blues unable to sign a replacement, Tomori may be required to stay at Stamford Bridge.
Chelsea are also in discussions with Burnley over a season-long loan move for out-of-favour midfielder Danny Drinkwater.
Lampard’s handling of the situation also makes it clear that he will not accept any challenges to his authority, despite his relative lack of managerial experience.

David Luiz didn't refuse to train. I was told he fell out with Lampard after a poor outing against Salzburg and refused to take corrections.

It was Lampard's decision to keep him away from training with the group while his transfer is sorted out.

========

Lampard's intended to use Luiz as a starter before Salzburg game, after that everything changed.

- Lampard tried unsuccessfully to correct Luiz.
- Luiz wouldn't listen
- Lampard said you won't be a starter then
- Luiz didn't take it well and misbehaved
- Lampard said you can go.
